info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 15 at 8:42PM MST until August 15 at 11:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai.
* WHEN...Until 1145 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 842 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Poplar Wash, Santa Maria River, Iron Spring Wash, Kirkland Creek, Sols Wash, Quail Spring Wash, Copper Creek, Eastwood Creek, Date Creek, Butte Creek, Little Sycamore Wash, Contreras Wash, Peoples Canyon, Little Shipp Wash, Tank Creek, Tonto Wash, Martinez Creek, North Fork Date Creek, Bland Creek, Loco Creek, Waterman Creek, Burnt Wash, Big Shipp Wash, Mineral Creek, Alkali Wash, Black Canyon Wash, Miller Wash, Tank Wash, South Fork Santa Maria River, Boulder Creek, Sycamore Creek, Smith Canyon, Burro Creek, Bullard Wash, Cottonwood Creek, Model Creek, Placeritas Creek, Cottonwood Canyon and Bridle Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... McLendon Peak, Hillside, Ives Peak, Hawkins, Tres Alamos Wilderness, Cottonwood Canyon, Weaver Peak, Congress, Bagdad, Bagdad Airport, Peeples Valley, Escapees North Ranch, Bullard Peak, Upper Burro Creek Wilderness, Date, Yava, Piedmont and Willow Spring. - This includes the following highways... Highway 93 between mile markers 149 and 191. State Route 96 between mile markers 0 and 21. State Route 71 between mile markers 90 and 109. State Route 89 between mile markers 263 and 271. State Route 97 between mile markers 156 and 166. - Additional information is available at weather.gov/flagstaff.
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Low water crossings will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM MST THIS EVENING
